gurmukhi: his bwq khI sMig goipn kwnH clo jmnw qt Kyl krYN ] ictkwrn so iBr kY iqh jw qum hUM hUM qro hm hUM hUM qrYN ]
transliteration: Has(i) Baat Kahisan(i) Gopan Kaahn Chalo Jamnaa Tat Khel Darain|| Chitkaaran So Bhir Kai Tih Jaa Toumdhoondhoon Daro Hamdhoondhoon Darain||
translation: Krishna said smilingly to gopis, “Come, let us play on the bank of Yamuna; we may splash water over another; you may swim and I may also swim:

gurmukhi: guih kY bn PUln suMdr hwr su kyl krYN iqn fwr grYN ] ibrhw CuD ko iqh Taur ibKY hs kY rs kY sMg pyt BrYN ]503]
transliteration: Guh(i) Kai Ban Phoolan Soundar Haar Su Kel Darain Tin Daar Darain|| Birhaa Chhudh Ko Tih Thaur Bikhai Has Kai Ras Kai San Pet Bdarain||503||
translation: We may absorb ourselves in amorous play, wearing beautiful garlands; we may end the anguish of separation by our sport.503.

gurmukhi: Awies mwn qbY hir ko sB Dwie clI gupIAw iqh TaUrYN ] eyk clY muskwie BlI ibD eyk clY hrUey iek daurYN ]
transliteration: Ooees Maan Tabai Har(i) Ko Sabh Dhaae Chaligoupeeaa Tih Thaurain|| Ek Chalai Mouskaae Bhalibidh Ek Chalai Darooe Ik Daurain||
translation: Agreeing with Krishna, all the gopis moved towards that place; one is walking smilinglu, the other is walking slowly and someone is running’

gurmukhi: sXwm khY aupmw iqhkI jl mY jmunw khu gÍwrn haUrYN ] rIJ rhY bn ky miRg dyK su Aaur ipKY gj gwmn saurYN ]504]
transliteration: Syaam Kahai Oupmaa Tih Kijal Mai Jamounnda Kauh Gvaaran Haoorain|| Reejh Rahai Ban Ke Mrig Dekh Su Aur Pikhai Gad Gadmanndsaurain||504||
translation: The poet Shyam says that the gopis are swimming the Yamuna’ s water and seeing those women of the gait of the elephant acting according to the wishes of their hearts, the deer of the forest are also getting pleased.504.

gurmukhi: sXwm smyq sBY gupIAw jmunw jl ko qir pwir pr`Xw ] pwr BeI jb hI ihq so igrdw kr kY iqh ko iqst`Xw ]
transliteration: Syaam Samet Sabhai Goupeeaa Jamounnda Jal Ko Tar(i) Daar(i) Parayyaa|| Paar Bhaijab Hihit So Girdaa Kar Kai Tih Ko Tistayyaa||
translation: All the gopis crossed Yamuna alongwith Krishna and went to the other side and gathering together stood in circle;

gurmukhi: qw Cib kI Aiq hI aupmw kib nY muK qy ieh BwNq sun`Xw ] kwnH BXo sis su`D mno sm rwjq gÍwrn qIr qr`Xw ]505]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Kiat(i) Hioupmaa Kabi Nai Moukh Te Eh Bhaant Sounayyaa|| Kaahn Bhayo Sas(i) Suddh Mano Sam Raajat Gvaaran Teer Tarayyaa||505||
translation: This spectacle appearead like this: that Krishna was like the moon and the gopis surrounding him looked like his family of stars.505.

gurmukhi: bwq lgI khny muK qy kiv sXwm khY iml kY sB gÍwrn ] cMmuKI miRg sy diRgnI lKIAY iqn Bwn AnMq Apwrn ]
transliteration: Baat Lagikahane Moukh Te Kavi Syaam Kahai Mil Kai Sabh Gvaaran|| Chaandramoukhimrig Se Drigaditin Bhaan Anant Apaaran||
translation: All the gopis, who were moon-faced and doe-eyed, began to talk amongst themselves:

gurmukhi: kwnH kY swQ krI crcw imil kY biRj kI sB suMdr bwrn ] Cor deI giH kI sB lwj su hoie mhwrs kI cskwrn ]506]
transliteration: Kaahn Kai Saath Karicharchaa Mil(i) Kai Brij Kisabh Soundar Baaran|| Chhodh Daigrih Kisabh Laaj Su Hoe(i) Mahaaras Keehaskaaran||506||
translation: The wanton damsels of Braja held discussion with Krishna about love and absorbed in this great relish, they abandoned all their shyness.506.

gurmukhi: kY rs ky hir kwrn kY kir kSt bfo koaU mMqr swDo ] kY koaU jMqR bfoeI sDXo ien ko Apny mn BIqr bwDo ]
transliteration: Kai Ras Ke Har(i) Kaaran Kai Kar(i) Kasht Bado Ko( i)  Mantar Saadho|| Kai Ko( i)  Jantra Badoisadhyo In Ko Apne Man Bheetar Baadho||
translation: The mind of the gopis feels greatly agitated on account of the absorption in love or for Krishna or because of a mantra or a powerful Yantra,

gurmukhi: kY kyhUM qMqR ky swD ikDo kib sXwm khY Aiq hI kir DwDo ] cor lXo mnu gÍwrn ko iCn BIqr dIn dXwiniD mwDo ]507]
transliteration: Kai Kehoon Tantra Ke Saadh Kidho Kabi Syaam Kahai At(i) Hikar(i) Dhaadho|| Chor Layo Man(u) Gvaaran Ko Chhin Bheerar Deen Dayaanidh(i) Maadho||507||
translation: Or it is blazing in extreme dread on account of a Tantra; Krishna, who is merciful to the lowly has stolen the mind of the gopis in an instant.507.

gurmukhi: kwnH ky gÍwrn swQ khXo hm ko qij kY ikh Er gey Qy ] pRIq bFwie mhw hm so jmunw qt pY rs kyl key Qy ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ke Gvaaran Saath Kahyo Ham Ko Taj(i) Kai Kih Or Gad The|| Preet Badhaae Mahaa Ham So Jamounnda Tat Pai Ras Kel Kae The||
translation: Gopis said to Krishna, “Where had you gone after leaving us? You had loved us and were absorbed in amorous play with us on the bank of Yamuna;
